Sequence Information.Peptide Name: DRS-CA-1 (dermaseptin; natural AMPs; frog, amphibians, animals; XXA; UCLL1c)

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that the sequence of the peptide shows 92.9% similarity toDermaseptin-B4.14% V, L, A, 17% K, and 10% N. Mol Wt: 3025.595; GRAVY: -0.064;  mol formula: C135H234N35O38S1.Activity: Active against S. aureus MRSA (MIC 4-8 uM), E. coli (MIC 4 uM) and C. albicans (MIC 4 uM), P. aeruginosa (MIC 8 uM), K. pneumoniae (MIC 8 uM), and E.faecalis (MIC 128 uM). MBC can much higher. Horse blood RBC: HC50 114.7 uM, not hemo.lytic.Structure: Helical in 50% TFE.Toxicity:  no anti-proliferative activity against all five human cancer cell lines and normal human HMEC-1 cells at 100 uM. Updated 7/2021
Literature Information.Author: Zhu H, Ding X, Li W, Lu T, Ma C, Xi X, Wang L, Zhou M, Burden R, Chen T.2018
Literature Information.Title: Discovery of two skin-derived dermaseptins and design of a TAT-fusion analogue with broad-spectrum antimicrobial activity and low cytotoxicity on healthy cells.
